metadata.title: CVE-2018-16883 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
sssd versions from 1.13.0 to before 2.0.0 did not properly restrict accessto the infopipe according to the "allowed_uids" configuration parameter. Ifsensitive information were stored in the user directory, this could beinadvertently disclosed to local attackers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
libnss-sss - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
libpam-sss - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
libsss-certmap0 - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
libsss-idmap0 - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
libsss-sudo - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
python3-libipa-hbac - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
python3-sss - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-ad - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-ad-common - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-common - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-dbus - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-idp - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-ipa - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-kcm - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-krb5 - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-krb5-common - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-ldap - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-passkey - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-proxy - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
sssd-tools - 2.8.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.1-1ubuntu1').
